commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Don't let regex extend outside of string bounds
commits.body: This corrects an issue with legal strings such as `r'('` and `r'[[]'`. Fixes #1.

commits.author: Matthew Schinckel
commits.summary: Auto-indent on square brackets, as well as braces.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Explicitly request TM_ERROR_FD for stack trace/error output

commits.author: Chris Adams
commits.summary: PyCheckMate: Add Python 3 support
commits.body:
* Use print function (supported back to Python 2.6)
* Versioned import for urllib.quote / urllib.parse.quote
* Updated except syntax
* Declare a file encoding
* Bump version number

commits.author: Chris Adams
commits.summary: Add frosted to the list of checkers

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Disable indent corrections for 2.0-alpha.9517
commits.body: With build 2.0-alpha.9517 a string value is not treated as a boolean. Presumably the value should be changed to ‘emptyLines’ but that will enable indent corrections for people using earlier builds, so we are delaying that change.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Revert "Trigger “indent current line” after inserting a colon"
commits.body:
While this works for it's intended purpose (elif/else) it gets triggered in too many other places to be functional. Since we can't currently tell if we are on a line with an elif/else we have to remove this.

This reverts commit ef08362f19f9e361c3ff8725411c910e3d944bcd.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Add squiggly braces as increase/decrease indent characters
commits.body: Although we have “indent as you type” disabled for Python, we should still strive to have correct indent patterns since we estimate indent after pressing return and (recently) typing a colon.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Trigger “indent current line” after inserting a colon
commits.body:
Since we have disabled indent-as-you-type for Python, we don’t get the automatic decrease of indent when typing the else keyword in an indented if block.

This commit adds the colon as a special case for triggering automatic indent of the current line. Ideally there would be an option to only partially disable TextMate’s indent-as-you-type so that this macro was not required.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Disable string quote characters inside block strings
commits.body: This allows manually typing the end of the string without getting four quotes, fixes #29.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Remove special scoping of empty strings
commits.body: We can now accomplish the same with left/right scope matches.

commits.author: MinRK
commits.summary: Fix txmt:// column param in pycheckmate
commits.body: Per [the url scheme](http://blog.macromates.com/2007/the-textmate-url-scheme/).

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Revert "Don’t use stack trace formatter if TM_PYTHON contains ‘3’"
commits.body: The issue that caused this to be needed has been fixed in e62bab275dd6b942e03f40bf26f88ab73a8e7071. The exception catcher still does not work under Python 3 but it no longer causes an exception itself.

commits.author: Nathan Henrie
commits.summary: Avoid Python3 "list.remove(x): x not in list" error
commits.body:
Every time TextMate2 updates (and refreshes this file), I get the following error running in-app with Python3 (Python works fine).

	Error in sitecustomize; set PYTHONVERBOSE for traceback: ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list

It looks like my sitecustomize is being run twice with Python3 (lines 20-25), which is provoking the error; the `os.environ['TM_BUNDLE_SUPPORT']` is removed the first time, so it gives an error trying to remove it the second.

This problem has also been looked at [here](https://github.com/mxcl/homebrew/pull/16848) and [here](https://github.com/textmate/textmate/issues/812).

commits.author: Michael Rabbitt
commits.summary: Use Python 3 syntax for Try… snippets
commits.body:

http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3110/#implementation

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Prevent self snippet from working inside strings
commits.body: This is to prevent false positives when tabbing within a string, especially when inside another snippet. Fixes #26.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Add python shebang line snippet (<kbd class='tabTrigger'>py⇥</kbd>)
commits.body: This is usable in any document provided the `py` trigger is at the very start of the document.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Move whitespace match into the group to improve scope
commits.body: Fixes #21.

commits.author: Kevin Sawicki
commits.summary: Add gypi to fileTypes

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Don’t use stack trace formatter if TM_PYTHON contains ‘3’
commits.body:
This is a crude heuristic to test if the user is using Python3, for which our ‘sitecustomize.py’ (used to catch exceptions and present a nice hyperlinked stack trace) does not work.

Closes textmate/textmate#812.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Update “Execute Line” command
commits.body:
Incase of errors from ‘eval’ we simply show a tool tip with what we tried to evaluate rather than try to dump the stack. The stack dump code wasn’t working, closes #15.

When evaluating the selection we now insert ‘ #=> ’ before the result. There was a typo in the code so previously a newline was always inserted before the result.

commits.author: Kevin Sawicki
commits.summary: Add gyp to fileTypes Signed-off-by: Adam Vandenberg <flangy@gmail.com>

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Ignore shebang when TM_PYTHON is set (<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌘R</kbd>)
commits.body: This way you can use a shebang that finds python via PATH (/usr/bin/env) but force TextMate to use a specific version.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Run command: Stack trace was missing first line
commits.body: Initially the Python script runner was written in Python and used execfile() to run the user script. This meant the runner itself had an entry on the stack trace which we explicitly had to skip.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Run command: Output links even for untitled documents
commits.body: I assume the reason links were skipped for “TM_FILE_IS_UNTITLED” was because the original author didn’t bother adding the code to remove the URL-part of the txmt://-links. Since TextMate.executor handles conversion of the links, there should be no need to special-case the “untitled document” case in this file.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Let TextMate save (on <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌘R</kbd>) unless document is untitled
commits.body: This is a subtle change but it means that all but untitled documents are saved by TextMate where previously the command would always be responsible for saving, which meant encoding, callbacks, and similar weren’t respected, and there was a theoretical synchronization problem (TextMate having to get notified that the file changed on disk and notice that it was (now) identical to the modified version in memory).
